name: Front Neck Stretch
how_to_perform:
1. Start by sitting or standing with your back straight and a long spine.

2. Bring one arm across your body, towards the opposite shoulder, by flexing at your elbow joint.

3. Keep your other hand planted firmly on your hip for support as you feel the stretch in the front part of your neck and shoulder region.

4. You can deepen the stretch by leaning forward slightly with your head or keeping a straight back.

5. Hold this position momentarily and repeat the stretch on the opposite side using your other arm.
short_summary: The Front Neck Stretch primarily targets the muscles around the neck area, providing relief from tension caused by slouching or poor posture.
